Please join us in congratulating UPHS' Adam Dockery for being named a finalist for the National Merit Scholarship Program. Adam was presented with a Certificate of Merit from Dr. Carpenter and Mrs. Traub last week. Adam plans to attend Michigan State University in the fall.

In each annual National Merit Scholarship Program, about 50,000 academically talented high school students are honored, but only some 16,000 of them are named Semifinalists. Students who qualify as Semifinalists based on their performance on the Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test (PSAT/NMSQT) are the only program participants who have an opportunity to advance to the Finalist level and compete for National Merit Scholarships. About 7,600 of the outstanding Finalists will be chosen as Merit Scholarship winners in the 2020 competition.

NEW TO UPSD IN 2020: BUS STATUS APP

The UPSD Transportation Department is excited to release our new Bus Status App, just in time for the New Year! Starting on January 2, 2020, this free app will be used as a communication tool that will provide students and parents the ability to receive push notifications to your smartphone or tablet about one particular bus, multiple buses or all the buses within just a few seconds.

The Bus Status App will be the quickest way for you to get updates on any bus delay, change or adjustment from the normal daily times and routes. Anyone can download the app including babysitters, grandparents or even older students themselves.

Once you download the Bus Status App, simply select your preferred bus(es) as a favorite and alerts will be sent directly to your phone or tablet (you might need to allow push notifications to your phone as well!)

More information is on our transportation webpage: http://www.upsd.org/departments/transportation

post_text: We were so excited to welcome back teachers yesterday that we hosted a parade in their honor!
